credit_line: Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund
title: Design for a monument to Emperor Charles VI of Naples
medium: Pen and black ink,  brush and black wash, black chalk on cream laid paper.
description: An allegory of Victory crowns Charles VI on horseback. Minerva, goddess of war, leads his horse. This group is flanked by Prudence (on left) and Justice (at right) on base.  Fortune and Temperance recline on top of base.  Squared for transfer. Scale at bottom.
name: Drawing
